##In the wake of the epidemic, I've been a homebody. | story

Story

Features, welcome to the story FM. Here, we tell your story with your voice. Every Monday, Wednesday and Friday, all platforms are updated simultaneously.

Click on the picture above to jump to the "story FM" applet and listen to the real person. Remember to add "my little program" , one-click to listen to the whole story Yo!

Because of the impact of the new pneumonia epidemic, so far, many people may have been at home for more than half a month.

Living a closed life for a long time, and lack of outdoor socializing and entertainment, can affect one's mood to some extent. So many experts, the media are appeal, not only pay attention to physical protection, but also pay attention to mental health.

Last week, we did a story collection where we asked people to tell us about their lives at home. From these stories, you can see that even under the influence of an epidemic, people are always coming up with new ideas for how to stay in a relationship.

Now, let's hear their stories, hoping to bring you a little relief on a day like this.

Wei Zai, 35, Changsha, Hunan

Since the holidays, my wife and children, the three of US basically repeat the same action every day, is not sleep or eat, has been in a state of mental depression.

Luckily, I'm more of a fun guy, so I can find a way to deal with it.

We have more female colleagues, but their husbands and I are very good relations. We have a common wechat group, usually nothing will call out to drink together.

Because this is a very special time and you can't go out. Just through the written contact, seems to be unable to express the feelings of missing each other.

So we came up with an idea, every night around 10 o'clock, five or six people in the group open a video chat, "cloud drink" together.

■ Wei and his friends in the group raise their glasses

Although the chat is nothing more than family gossip, to relieve boredom. But who eats what every day will be a big part of this "online drinking game" .

At the beginning, we have a relatively complete family reserves, Hunan's unique preserved fish bacon, salted duck sauce, special lo-mei and so on. And we'll see who's got the most stuff on the table and who's got the most money.

Before and After

Later, because there is no chance to go out, go out also can not buy things, the home stock is less and less, our food is only a little peanut, potato chips.

In fact, get together is not to drink, drink what in fact does not matter, just want everyone to chat together, every day can have a look forward to a good night's sleep.

Lu Sun, Yongjia, Wenzhou

Because the in-laws are getting old and want to return to the place where they lived when they were young, they moved back to the countryside years ago. I came with you. I'm not familiar with the environment or the people. Outside the city, my heart slowly into a semi-closed state.

■ Lu Taiyang walks past a junkyard before closing the city

Luckily, I had a college group of four. Since this outbreak began, we've been paying particular attention, sharing information on a daily basis. Although we graduated 10 years ago, we still occasionally in the group have a non-together to talk, are serious topics on current affairs, almost no small talk.

One of the girls asked, "what are you guys doing for the next few days? " I said casually, "we can play cards! " So he went to search the next small procedure, "happy fight landlord" into the group, and we began to play cards.

■ A screenshot of Lu Taiyang's cell phone while typing "happy fight with landlord. "

Why would I, who had only played cards two or three times in his life, bring up such a proposition? There's a story, actually.

A few years ago, I was talking to a friend. He talked about being sent to his aunt's house in the countryside when he was about 10 years old because he had broken his leg and his parents had no time to take care of him. His aunt and uncle played cards with him every day, and he felt very happy in those months.

I've always been a serious person, but the story stuck in my head so well that it occurred to me that playing cards together might be a good way to interact with friends.

But we never play online poker group of people, especially like behind the Times of the old aunt!

As soon as we got inside, everything was new. For example, your Tsutsu needs to hit $1,000 to play with other people, but I didn't know how to play at first, and soon I was broke. I've been counting Tsutsu every day since the 23rd, and almost every day I've run out of Tsutsu. I never wake up one day and realize I'm not broke.

"Now all the Chinese people know that I am a landlord with thin skin and loose hair, smiling face. "

Slowly, I found that through the game can really deepen their own understanding of others.

When I was playing with my friends, I was totally relaxed. When no one calls the landlord, I call even if my cards are bad. I really want to have fun with them, and sometimes I fight.

Our Group of college students, before we are not good at small talk, each time there is a clear topic just a few words. But this time, we had an opportunity to participate in each other's daily lives.

One of the editors, she was working every day, and one day she suddenly said, "I've been working 12 hours straight today, and now I need to play a game of cards. ". She never used to say things like that.

In a sense, the holiday from the outbreak has given those who were not directly, deeply affected by the disaster more time to spend with family or friends. But at this time, the game brings the connection between people and the consolation loan appears to be particularly rare.

By the way, look at my friend with the broken leg. Twenty years later, he still remembers playing cards with his aunt and uncle when he was 10. It may sound silly and undignified, but I also think I will remember fighting with my friends against landlords in this epidemic.

Jadey, Sydney, phd

I returned to Australia from the mainland on January 30 and had been quarantined from my home in Sydney for 14 days by February 12.

I rented a one bedroom house in Sydney with my boyfriend, and since my boyfriend didn't return home, we were separated from each other when I got back, as if my boyfriend was living in the living room, I was living in the bedroom, usually rely on wechat voice communication, the only chance of a face-to-face is on my way to the kitchen or bathroom, we will wear masks chat a few words.

It's my last day of isolation, and I'm getting bored. Sydney a few days ago in a heavy rain, the room is very stuffy, I stood on the edge of the bed to look at the outside of the rain, from time to time to touch the outside raindrops.

■ during her isolation, Jadey recorded the view from her window

Nothing makes me feel happy, maybe just a little bit less tense when I'm playing a game. When I'm alone, I can't help but swipe my phone, watch the news, and watch the numbers change.

It's only when I play the game that I get a little distracted. Since I couldn't meet them, I would play team games with my friends in the WECHAT APP, as if meeting with friends had been moved to the Internet.

We also re-played some of the very early QQ games, such as "even look" , "we come to find fault" and so on. Last time I played was in high school, and now I'm doing my phd. But unlike before, now these games, you can see the status of the friends playing, but also see their game results.

It made me feel like I was playing with everyone, even though I was isolated in a small room. I watched my friends go back and forth to and from the "room" in the game, or even play a game can also quarrel, I feel very graphic, full of memories and life.

"It made me feel like I was playing face-to-face with everyone, even though I was isolated in a small room. "

Although I was in Sydney, I felt close to my friends, not so far away.

■ For 14 days, some of Jadey's meals were cooked with a single set of utensils, each meal sterilized with alcohol and boiled in water, and placed separately on a table that served as her bedside table.

White Goose, Nanjing, Film and Television Practitioners

Actually, with the flu from mid-january, I've been home for a month.

Since I'm a freelancer, life hasn't changed much for me, except that I travel less.

My parents have changed a little. It's come to my attention that my mother has recently resumed knitting. I remember she was going to knit me one, but then she put it away. Recently, the project has been restarted.

And my dad was a very disciplined man. He works at the school, and these days, even though he has no job, he keeps his life in order.

But my father's disciplined life at home was often interrupted by a One Hour Photo -- the Cat in my house.

The white goose's cat, stinky

As my father is usually very busy with his work, he seldom has time to play with my cat. Lately, they've been spending more time together, and our cat has become more and more attached to my dad.

Whenever my dad was getting down to his business, the cat would try to lure him out onto the balcony for his exclusive "deep massage. ".

By "deep massage, " he meant that he would lie on a triangular scratching board on the balcony and stretch out so my father could scratch him. As it does so, it rolls over and over, looking a little creepy, like it's taking a bath.

Since my dad stayed at home, deep massage has become my cat's favorite activity, requiring his services several times a day.

One time, my dad was so tickled to death, he started yelling at home, "when is school starting? I want to start. ". Of course, it seemed to me that he was enjoying himself in the back of his mind.

Xiao Wo, Liaoning, Anshan, Dalian work

I came home to Anshan on New Year's Eve.

I was so anxious that I couldn't do anything but watch the news on my phone. What makes me even more anxious is that the epidemic has become so serious that my father still has to go to the village Mahjong Parlor during the Spring Festival.

Around Wolfie's house

On the afternoon of the New Year's Day, my father went out after having dinner at home. So I warned him, and I said, "don't go out, don't play mah-jongg! "

I couldn't talk my dad out of it, and he went anyway, and it wasn't just that day, it was eighth grade, too.

I don't think this is gonNA work. I need a plan. I saw on Weibo that a girl from Sichuan had reported her father because her father insisted on going to a Mahjong Parlor. I thought I should report him too.

Then I watched for a day, and when my dad went out to play cards again, I decided to call.

It was the first time in my life that I called 110, and I was quite upset. When I got through, I realized that my uncle was speaking in my hometown accent.

Uncle asked me, "which one do you want to report? "

I said, "I'll report it! All OUR MAHJONG PARLORS ARE OPEN! "

Because I couldn't remember the exact names of the Mahjong Parlors, the policeman referred me to the town police station. After they knew which village I was from, they quickly said, "ok, wait a minute, let me go and take them all out. ". "

I called at noon, and when I got off the phone, I was watching to see if my dad was home. About this afternoon, my dad came home. But I saw him acting strange, sitting alone in the car for more than twenty minutes before he came in.

I guess the people from the police station went to the Mahjong Parlor in the afternoon and dismissed all the Mahjong players.

And I was too afraid to ask my dad directly, just at night, to sneak up to my mom and ask her, "My dad was in the car for 20 minutes before he came home today, and you know what happened to him? "

But it didn't work out. My mom had a big heart, and she didn't care, "don't worry about him. Don't worry about him. "

Moon God, 26, Huanggang, Hubei

Huanggang is one of the worst affected areas after Wuhan, so it has attracted national attention.

January 24th is New Year's Eve, and it's a day that really impresses me, including my parents who say it's the most memorable New Year's Day they've had in more than 50 years.

Remember to eat dinner after eight o'clock, just happened to be broadcast on television in the Spring Festival evening show the host to Wuhan cheering program. We saw a very moved, but also feel that everyone in Hubei, where I am concerned about the city.

In the park near the House of the Moon God, as night falls

But at this time, the electricity suddenly stopped, all of a sudden all the black house.

Looking out, the whole building, the whole property, the whole neighborhood is dark. We feel like an island, forgotten, like all the lively, bright and we seem to be far away.

I was suddenly in a bad mood.

And then my mom would find a candle in the room and light it. That day originally afternoon is cloudy day, also rained to the evening. The Winter Rain in Hubei is very cold and cold.

I was sitting on the couch with my family, and I realized I hadn't talked to them in a long time. When I grew up, my brother and I were busy studying and working, and our family only saw each other once or twice a year.

Because the closure of the city came so suddenly, in fact, there are some people in the family did not go home. I suggested that we play cards and give red envelopes to the families who won out of town. So that no matter how far away we are, the family can play together.

The Moon God family's lively wechat group chat

I helped them download happy fight landlords and Mahjong on their mobile phones. As a result, we sent a lot of red packets in the group, that day is my parents and I wechat chat record inside the back and forth of the day. In the ordinary day basically a week or two only contact once, but that night back and forth sent more than 200 wechat.

By early morning, the power was back on, and someone was setting off fireworks in the distance. I stood there watching the fireworks with my family, and I felt so relieved.

In this special New Year's Eve, through playing cards, I also harvested belongs to our family's Spring Festival reunion.

——————

From these stories, you can see the diversity of people's lives in an epidemic.

Some people have video chat with their friends and drink wine together. Some people are "broke" but talk to their friends more. Some people report that her father is playing cards outside. Some people get their family reunion by playing cards on New Year's Eve.

But in general, not being able to go out didn't make people less social, but more time to play games and chat with family and friends.

We found that online entertainment is actually quite good, both to reduce the offline gathering, but also do not delay the relationship.

In this period of time, do you have any usual entertainment, hobbies to move online? Please share your experiences in the comments section.

Thank you for listening, and look forward to the end of the epidemic, you and your family are safe and sound!
